Fields.DialogueText: Reporting as ordered, Captain. I have my notes ready for the strategy brief.
And, we're waiting on Atlantis, as usual.
Did you see her on your way here?
I did not, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure she will arrive soon.
I thought we were over this...
Did she say anything to you about it?

Fields.DialogueText: I could not say, Captain. She gave no indication to me about her intentions.
May I ask what you mean by that, Captain?
She spoke nothing of it to me, Captain.
She's gone quiet again.
Captain?
Say nothing of this to the crew, but Atlantis has a history of being... tight-lipped. I'm not certain what she's up to.
The crew actually finds her inspirational. I know that I do.
And we don't want anything to change that.
I appreciate your punctuality, Officer Jin, but let's postpone this brief...
Of course, Captain. I'll take my notes back to my quarters.
*ALARM*
No time for that right now. To the bridge.
Aye aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
A clear horizon, fair weather, and no scheduled events for the ship. Atlantis will need a great excuse to avoid a conversation this time.
Atlantis.
Kapitän.
Well?

Fields.MenuText: Have I done something to offend you, or...?
Some might consider your behavior to be... Unprofessional. Perhaps even insubordinate.
I thought we were establishing a better working relationship than this.

Fields.DialogueText: Nein. Nothing could be farther from the truth.
I would never wish to encourage that sort of Reputation, Kapitän.
I have no Intention of showing you any disrespect, Kapitän.
My recent Pflichten have kept me occupied.
It's no secret that you work hard, Atlantis. Even so, you seem to be reverting to some old habits.
Inadequate Kommunikation.
That's the one that concerns me.
Ach so. If you have a Moment, I can explain myself-
*ALARM*
All in good time, Atlantis. First things first.
Ich bin bereit.
@BATTLE
Attention on deck!
Am I interrupting anything?
Atlantis was waiting for you to arrive before starting the training session.
Please begin, Atlantis.
Danke, Kapitän.
May I bitten um your attention? Our Training will focus on Schiff configurations and visual identification.
Bitte turn your attention to this chart I have prepared...

Fields.MenuText: (Impressive. She's put a lot of work into this presentation.)
(Interesting. I wonder why she chose this topic?)
(Ugh, I hope some Morganas show up before we all fall asleep!)

Fields.DialogueText: Do not be intimidated by the Diagramme. The Konzepte are important, but quite simple.
Our mission effectiveness can be enhanced by applying these Konzepte.
Kapitän, would you like some Kaffee? I brewed a fresh Kanne for those who may need some.
The critical idea is simple. We identify other Schiffe by how they look.
We see Flaggen und Farben. We see the shape of the hull. We see other Details as well.
And we use the visual information to tell us friend or foe.
Excellent, Officer Jin. "Freund oder Feind" is one of the most important things to determine, but it is not the only thing.
Consider the following Szenario...
*ALARM*
Sounds like our lookouts decided on "foe."
The training will have to wait, Atlantis.
Natürlich, Kapitän.
Let's get to battle stations!
@BATTLE
Good thinking, Atlantis.
We still have to do more training? I thought we were done.
We didn't finish last time.
Ugh, I never thought I'd find myself wishing for another Morgana attack.
Did you say something about a Morgana attack?
Oh! Hello, Captain.
We didn't know you were sitting back there.

Fields.MenuText: I hope you have more situational awareness in combat.
I'd like to see a little more respect as the ship's commanding officer.
I expect you to show more respect for Atlantis and her hard work.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll keep that in mind.
We meant no disrespect, Captain.
I didn't mean to sound ungrateful, Captain! All of us hold Atlantis in high regard.
Conduct yourself accordingly, officers. Ah, here she is.
Tut mir Leid, euch warten zu lassen. Kapitän, ship's officers... let me resume where we left off.
Often, we do not have radio contact or Erkenntnisse to guide our response when we see a Schiff on the Wasser with us.
We must train ourselves to use what we see and quickly assess the Situation.
Gleichzeitig we have to look and think carefully, to avoid fatal mistakes. This Training will help to enable you-
*ALARM*
Morgana contact again? Let's get going.
@BATTLE
You have a serious look on your face. Are you all right?
I should heed my own advice and control my äußere appearance.
If it makes you feel any better, you're still tough to read.
I cannot hide my concerns about our last Alarm.
At least there was no combat. It turned out to be a merchant vessel instead of Morgana ships.
Trotzdem, I am still unhappy.

Fields.MenuText: It interrupted your training. That can be frustrating.
It was a false alarm. That should be a relief.
I'm concerned as well. Our lookout and our deck officer made a mistake.

Fields.DialogueText: That does not trouble me, Kapitän. I am more concerned about the Fehler that was made.
But it could have been terrible. Imagine if we mistook a foe for a friend. Or umgekehrt.
So ist es. They mistook a ziviles Schiff for an enemy. If we had not recognized the mistake rechtzeitig...
I understand. If our lookouts can't correctly identify what they see, we could end up in big trouble.
I would like to reschedule our Training as soon as possible.
I'll see what we can do. Until then, spend some extra time on the bridge helping the lookouts.
Jawohl, Kapitän. I will see what I can teach them.
Hey. You can teach them a lot. In fact, you do teach them a lot. I've even heard you described as, and I quote, "inspirational" a few times.
@BATTLE
And that was just a random crew member. If you want to get into the good things *I've* said about you I can go for a couple of hours.
*ALARM*
... Maybe another time.
Aber I do appreciate the thought.
Seaman Brooks, while you were on duty as the ship's lookout, you identified a friendly ship as a hostile one. Das war inkorrekt!
Und inakzeptabel! This error cannot go unpunished.
It was an honest mistake, Schiffsdame Atlantis! I thought I saw dark smoke, and.. and... I wasn't even supposed to be the lookout.
I was covering for somebody else because they had to use the toilet!
Dienst ist Dienst! If we had fired upon a friendly target, because of your mistake-

Fields.MenuText: True. The consequences could have been terrible.
I wasn't here for the whole conversation, but I think he understands, Atlantis.
I haven't seen much of your angry side, Atlantis. This is great!

Fields.DialogueText: Danke, Kapitän. That is precisely what I am saying.
Bitte, Kapitän, I am simply trying to be thorough.
Wie bitte?!
That's all for now, Seaman Brooks. Dismissed.
Aye aye! I'm outta here!
You can't be too hard on him, Atlantis. He wasn't at the training for the officers.
Then perhaps I need to scold the Offiziere next. They should be training the enlisted crew.
Fair enough. We all need to know the difference between a smokestack and a cannon.
"Smokestack?" You mean "funnel." Identifying a Schiff on the Horizont with these features is vital to differ Freund von Feind.
Point taken.
*ALARM*
Time to get going.
I hope this one is not a falscher Alarm again.
Really?
@BATTLE
Du wolltest mich sehen, Kapitän? I have a moment before I must return to my duties.
I just wanted to make sure you were all right.
Ach! You refer to my scolding of Seaman Brooks for his Nachlässigkeit.
I mean generally. Though, if you want to talk about that particular incident...
You thought it was untypisch for me?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not chastizing you - you certainly didn't do anything wrong. But you seemed angry, and that's unusual for you.
Maybe. I don't always find you the easiest person to read.
On second thought, I guess it really wasn't. The way you handled it was professional.

Fields.DialogueText: I was not angry, Kapitän. I was trying to address an issue that is vital to our Effektivität.
Das bereitet mir Sorge, Kapitän, but it does not surprise me.
Danke, Kapitän.
Und, in the end, you still felt the need to speak privately to me afterwards. Kapitän to Schiffsdame.
I apologize if it was unwelcome. I just... sometimes feel like you have to be reminded that I really do want to help if I can.
Ich muss weg!
*ALARM*
... At least I know she won't run from a fight.
@BATTLE
And, in fairness, I like speaking to you privately anyway.
Nein! It wasn't that at all! Nur...
That was meant to be light-hearted, not incredibly awkward.
Wait, you-
The engine room is squared away. It's no surprise on a German ship that-
Wait, was that Atlantis?
Guten Tag, Kapitän.
Officer Jin?
Ja? I mean, yes, Kapitän? Er... Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Have you seen Atlantis back here? I need to find her.
Are you sure that you're all right?
What are you doing in the engine room? Shouldn't you be steering the ship right now?

Fields.DialogueText: I haven't seen her. Is something wrong?
You have no reason to be concerned, Kapitän.
Officer Raleigh is the officer on deck right now.
Well, my inspection back here is complete. I have some other matters to attend to, if you will excuse me.
Of course...
"Officer Jin..."
@BATTLE
You called for me, Captain? Am I in trouble?
Relax, Officer Jin.
I followed all of your night orders, Captain. We had no incidents to report from my watch.
I said relax! You're not in trouble.
You summoned me to your cabin with a messenger instead of using the public address circuit, Captain. Is something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: You worry too much.
Back when you were inspecting the engine room...
Why did you call me "Kapitän" before, but now you keep calling me "Captain"?

Fields.DialogueText: My first captain taught me that a complacent officer endangers the whole crew.
The engine room? I didn't, Captain. Was I supposed to inspect the engine room?
I'm not sure what you're talking about. Usually Miss Atlantis calls you "Kapitän."
Just one more thing. Where's Atlantis right now?
I saw her inspecting the main gun a few minutes ago.
That's all I needed to know. Forget I mentioned it.
By your leave, Captain.
Dismissed. Thanks, Officer Jin.
If I wasn't sure before, I'm sure now. Time to talk to Atlantis.
*ALARM*
Morganas again? Why does this keep happening?! Maybe I need to quit talking to myself...
@BATTLE
Your first captain was right.
Officer Raleigh, I'm a bit surprised to see you here at the main gun.
Oh? We had just finished cleaning the 75mm before the Morganas arrived.
Now we've got to clean it again.
You don't have to keep pretending.
Pretending, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Pretending to work on that gun.
Pretending that you're surprised to see me.
Pretending to be Officer Raleigh.

Fields.DialogueText: What are you trying to say, Kapitän?
Surprised?
Oh...
I know what's going on, Atlantis.
Kapitän, I can explain!
If you do have a good explanation for impersonating fellow officers, maybe you should save it for a court martial.
Kriegsgericht?!
What do you think would happen if anybody reported you doing this? The German government thinks you're a security risk as it is!
No, I'm being paranoid. There's nobody on this crew that would turn you in. But, Atlantis, you need to....
*ALARM*
Listen, Officer Jin and Officer Raleigh don't need to know about what you did - but you need to stop doing it. Get to battle stations, and we'll talk later.
Jawohl, Kapitän.
Ugh...
@BATTLE
Mind if I come in? I brought some coffee for us.
Danke sehr, Kapitän. I appreciate your thoughtfulness, considering what I've done.
That's what I'm here to talk about – how you disguised yourself and impersonated at least two officers.

Fields.MenuText: Before anything else - I'm sorry I put you in a position where that felt necessary.
You're uncomfortable being yourself.
How many other times have you done it?

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän, nein! You aren't at fault here!
I don't like admitting that.
Bloß zweimal. Each time, you were the only one who noticed me.
For a Schiffsdame like me... I am constantly presented with reasons to doubt myself. I'm never far from a harsh judgment.
I was there. Don't forget that I met Herr Ziegler, too...
Ja.
... But, no matter how sympathetic I am, imagine how the crew would feel if they found out what you did.
Fürchterlich betrayed.
I'll overlook it, under two conditions.
I akzeptiere the conditions, no matter what they are.
One, you keep this to yourself. If any of the crew ever learns about it, it's because I choose to tell them.
And two, no disguises unless I am part of your plan.
Imagine what Officer Jin would do if she knew she had a doppelganger.
Ach! Every Morgana within 100 Kilometer would hear the Schreie!
Ha! I would have guessed 50 kilometers, but maybe your estimate's more accurate.
Danke sehr, Kapitän. For the Kaffee, and for understanding your Schiffsdame.
@BATTLE
... And, look, any time I cross a line or make you uncomfortable, I need you to tell me so I can hammer it into my thick skull.
That has never happened. Niemals!
Uh-huh.
Nein. The Tohuwabohu that unfolds in my head from Zeit zu Zeit is not your responsibility.
Relax.
*ALARM*
Mist.
Yeah, this is usually what happens when people try to get me to relax.
Good work getting the latest intelligence reports plotted on the chart.
Thanks, Captain. I'm heading back to the radio room, unless you need something else?
No. Dismissed, Officer Raleigh.
Wo ist es? Wo ist es?
Atlantis?
That doesn't sound good.
Es muss doch hier irgendwo sein.....Vielleicht ist es mir aus der Tasche gefallen?
She's lost something important. She keeps looking down at the deck and retracing her steps.
Wo ist meine... Kapitän!

Fields.MenuText: You've already checked this passageway at least twice.
What did you lose? It must be something important.
Need any help?

Fields.DialogueText: You noticed that.
I will find it.
Ja! I mean... Nein! I will... find it myself.
Are you looking for Ferry?
Ferry, our ship's mascot, is not missing. In fact, I fed our Scottish Terrier less than an hour ago... Ferry!
If I wasn't confused before, I am now...
@BATTLE
It is not, Kapitän.
I did.
I hope it isn't a classified document.
Komm! Komm her, Ferry!
*Arf!*
I see you hiding back there. Come out! Komm her! Komm zu mir and I will give you some Leckerli...
What in the world is she doing?
That's it, Ferry. A little closer to me. Komm her... Und was ist das? In your mouth... You naughty Hund. That belongs to me. Run along now, Ferry.
*sigh*

Fields.MenuText: Were you having some trouble with our ship's mascot?
Did you find what you were looking for?
Is this really how you spend your time? I'm sure we can find something more important for you to do.

Fields.DialogueText: A little, but now I can relax.
I... I did, ja.
I did not mean to neglect my other duties, aber es war dringend.
You seem relieved. It must have been something important that you recovered.
Es...
I take it back. Now you look like you're... Do you need a moment?
I... I do.
*ALARM*
We're definitely going to talk about this later.
Ja, Kapitän. Ich verstehe.
@BATTLE
*Arf!*
Is that really your order? To inventory the top secret materials safe?
That's right.
I completed the weekly inventory with Officer Raleigh just a few days ago. All of our top secret materials were accounted for...
I just want you to conduct the inventory again.
Was there something wrong with the last inventory? If just one page of paper is missing... that could be a disaster!

Fields.MenuText: Trust me, I understand the significance. That's why I'm trusting you to do a good job.
It's just a random check for extra security.
I saw something suspicious, and I just want to make sure none of our documents are missing.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought I did a good job... last time...
Ah. I see.
Say no more, Captain. I will take care of it.
I will make a report to you as soon as it is completed.
Thank you, Officer Jin.
The last thing I need on board is a thief... I trust Atlantis, but I have to make sure.
*ALARM*
Damn. Bad timing...
@BATTLE
May I enter, Kapitän?
I keep my cabin door unlocked. Come in, Atlantis. Take a seat.
Ich bevorzuge standing, if you do not mind, Kapitän.
Suit yourself. I have a fresh pot of coffee and an open schedule for the next few hours.
Just trying to make you comfortable. Since, you don't seem like you want to start, I will.

Fields.MenuText: You don't want people to see who you really are, behind the disguises.
I conducted an extra inventory of the top secret safe. Care to say anything about it?
I see what's going on, but I'll let you explain it.

Fields.DialogueText: I must admit that I am ashamed.
I saw die Offiziere Jin and Raleigh working with the top secret safe, but I... Oh. Kapitän, I assure you nothing like that is amiss!
I am not trying to keep secrets, but sometimes I feel an urge... mich etwas zu abzuschotten.
You saw me chasing our mascot around the Schiff. I had dropped something, and Ferry had picked it up.
And what was it that was so important? I know it wasn't a top secret document.
Mein Anhänger. A necklace I found among one of the Matrosen we picked up who didn't make it. And which reminds me what kind of German I really am. Ich konnte... I couldn't throw it away.
With Ziegler now gone for a while and things getting quiet, I felt like wearing it maybe and grübelte about it. But then I left it where Ferry could find it.
... May I see it?
Also gut. I'll show you. But you can't tell a soul, Kapitän!
On my honor.
*sigh* Here, that's my necklace.
Star of David? It's well made, I think. It suits you.
Of course, you've also got Aryan certification...
Kapitän, every one of us Schiffsdamen were given those papers - though we have neither Blut nor parents. They even debattieren about amending the laws for us - this is Germany.
... Can you bitte dismiss me? I would like to be allein now.
Of course. But I'm always here if you want to talk.
Danke, Kapitän.
What a damn mess. She doesn't deserve to live like this.
@BATTLE
I know. Officer Jin just reported a complete inventory.
I was afraid he could be seen with it or me in the wrong Moment.
We like everything orderly. And serving in the Kriegsmarine as an Offizier means you need an Ariernachweis. Schiffsdamen are Offiziere, so we all got issued one with our Wehrpässen.

Fields.MenuText: That's convenient, I suppose.
Humanity must seem collectively insane to you sometimes.
Thank you. For trusting me.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not my place to judge.
It might help keep the Zieglers of the world at bay, if nothing else.
Sieh her, Kapitän, and tell me what you think!
I'm glad to see everything finally assembled. When all of that gear came out of storage, it cluttered up the deck just lying around.
Look at our new... Arrangement.
Ah! Good work, Atlantis. The extra mast and the fake funnel are very clever.
Ja, it's a special capability of ours. Changing our Konfiguration makes us look different to other Schiffe.
Like a disguise.
Das stimmt. When a lookout on another ship sees us, they don't see us. They see something else.

Fields.MenuText: It could make us anonymous.
We could imitate another ship.
I wonder if we could impersonate a Morgana ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Anonym, ja. But, with a little work, we can do even better than that.
Precisely my Intention.
Oh! I admit, I had not thought of that myself. It could be possible irgendwann...
My Intention is to make us appear as a different Schiff. This Technik can allow us to approach sensitive targets without arousing suspicion or revealing our true Identität.
In fact, we can rearrange the false Aufbauten to create multiple profiles, not just one.
From far away, it could work. But, up close...
You're scharfsinnig. I like how you antizipierst the strategic concerns, Kapitän.
Just one of my many fine party tricks.
That said, I have already started to work on those Details. Komm down below, and I will show you what I'm working on.
I'm excited to see it...
*ALARM*
But first things first!
Ich bin bereit, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Ha!
Captain! They... Out of nowhere... Captain, I... I don't know HOW he got on board, but...
Slow down and breathe.
Never saw another ship... But he... Out of nowhere...
Officer Jin, I can't understand you like this.
Somebody came aboard, Captain... a Russian kapitan...
Oh?
We have absolutely no idea how he got here.

Fields.MenuText: A visit from another Belle is a nice surprise. Where is she?
Remind me to talk to the sergeant-at-arms about security later.
Another Belle? I doubt it. Let me guess – nobody saw the new Belle and our Belle in the same room together.

Fields.DialogueText: On the bridge, but he said he was coming down here to your cabin.
Should I have the crew repel boarders, Captain?
Now that you mention it, Captain...
Greetings! Kapitan Ivanov at your service!
Oh, really? Ivanov, you say? Then welcome aboard. *chuckle*
Spasibo! Thank you for the warm welcome!
What's this? A Russian captain?
Ne Russkiy?
*ALARM*
Get to battle stations.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Yes, Captain!
Was that fun, Atlantis?
Maybe just a little bit. And I wasn't impersonating our own officers, so...
You still have to help me unscramble Officer Jin's brain after the fight.
@BATTLE
No need. I don't think we have anything to fear from our visitor.
Atlantis, there's a face I haven't seen you make before. If you told me you were trying to burn a hole in that bulkhead with your eyes, I'd believe it.
You would?

Fields.MenuText: I just meant that you had an intense look on your face.
If anything is going to burn up, it's your brain. You're thinking way too hard about something.
Who knows? Maybe you have super powers, and you aren't telling me.

Fields.DialogueText: I lost my Gelassenheit. I am troubled enough that I became unaware of my expression.
I'm worried about my Effekt on the crew. Did my Demonstration hurt them?
Ach! If I could reach within and entfessel the true...
Listen, I know I gave you grief - rightly - for impersonating crew members, but this was just play. I promise, it's being taken as fun.
When I demonstriert my Imitationen and disguises, I upset Officer Jin and the others.
You had my consent. You could even say I was supervising. Besides, we agreed it was time for them to know.
Take some time. Do all the thinking you need to do, but be careful.
Careful of what, Kapitän?
Careful you don't actually burn a hole through the bulkhead.
Danke, Kapitän.
I can guess what's on your mind.
Seriously?
Nein, nein... That was a foolish thing for me to say. Besides, I need to think about the crew.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
All maintenance on the Kanonen is completed, Kapitän. I have reports on crew training for you to review, as well.
I don't need to read them, Atlantis.
Nicht?
I can tell from your demeanor that everything was to your high standards.
You can? Ist es wirklich so offensichtlich?

Fields.MenuText: It is.
Your posture, your tone of voice. I don't know for sure. Intuition, I guess.
My mental super powers allow me to read your mind.

Fields.DialogueText: You are like a Magier. One who will not reveal the secret behind the Tricks.
Interessant...
*gasp* Your file never mentioned that you had Atlantisches blood...
You are able to read me.
When people work together, it happens. It's nice to develop a relationship like that, wouldn't you agree?
Stimmt - but that is why I was so concerned about the crew when you spoke to me before.
I showed them etwas about myself, about my capabilities for disguises.
Being candid and honest meant displaying how well I can lie. How can they trust a Schiffsdame like that?
You're still being too hard on yourself. You showed them an amazing skill that you have, and you let them look behind the curtain.
A Magierin who revealed her Tricks.
Or a friend who was showing off a little to people she trusts.
Oh...
*ALARM*
The guns are ready for a fight. Is our Schiffsdame in good condition, too?
She is, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
What in the hell are you talking about?
Forget I said those things. You were just necken me a bit.
Our hull configuration is set, and we have stationed topside personnel in their costume uniforms, Captain.
Excellent, Officer Jin. If any Morganas spotted us here before, they won't recognize us now.
Our seaplane has launched safely, Kapitän.
Our painted one?
Flying with Japanischen colors. The pilot has been instructed to fly low enough to be spotted.
You're forgetting one last thing.
Ah! Sehr richtig!
Arigato for the reminder, Captain. Sato-taisa, commanding a proud Juu junyohkan of the Empire, reporting for duty!
Incredible...

Fields.MenuText: What?! Takao? And, where did Atlantis go? Bring her back!
Nobody will believe a ship of our size is a heavy cruiser, no matter how many fake masts we assemble.
It's still you in there, Atlantis... right?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Very funny, Captain. You know it's me, Atlantis.
Show some confidence, Captain! I can be quite convincing.
Ha! Very funny, Captain.
I'm heading to the radio room, Captain.
Good. Let me know as soon as we intercept any communications.
Aye aye, Captain.
Ready to get started?
Hai!
Engines all ahead full. Time for us to be seen.
@BATTLE
Jin-Ikan, are you certain that the crew is comfortable? Not everybody enjoys wearing a disguise.
They understand the tactical advantage of our deceptive appearance. Also, I think the crew's actually having fun with it, Schiffsdame Atlantis.
I mean... Sato-sama.
Hai!
Is it easier this way? My normale appearance may...
Quite all right. I know who you are inside. Captain, please excuse me, but I need to get back to my station. Morganas could show up at any moment now.
Of course.
Did that seem genuine to you, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Nobody could miss that smile. She's sincere.
You heard her. She said she knows it's you on the inside.
She couldn't wait to get away from you!

Fields.DialogueText: I've never had so many Probleme reading people before.
Those are not Worte I'm used to hearing...
I'm not glücklich to hear that, but I expected it.
The crew is fine, Atlantis. Quit thinking they can't trust or respect you, because I know they do.
Richtig... richtig...
@BATTLE
And your captain thinks you're doing a fantastic job, I might add.
Tja, as you know, I value my captain's opinions immensely.
She says as she tries not to giggle.
Mind your helm. Keep us running close to the shore, not onto it. I'd rather not run aground today.
Ja, Kapitän... But, I want to make sure we are nah enough to be noticed.
I just realized something...

Fields.MenuText: You're probably anxious about operating this close to land. German HQ never let you do it before.
You've probably been eager to make a run at the coast ever since we got rid of Ziegler.
Are you self-conscious about being seen?

Fields.DialogueText: The Reich was not eager to have someone with my background in the spotlight.
I don't exactly like hearing that Name again, but you are right.
I am not afraid of it. Immerhin, things are different now.
Seit you helped me get rid of that Pest Ziegler, I have enjoyed having more freedom.
Captain, we've intercepted radio transmissions from local marine traffic. They include reports about a Japanese seaplane and a Japanese heavy cruiser.
Anything about a certain German auxiliary cruiser?
Nothing, Captain.
Excellent.
Then it's time for the area to see the rest of the "Japanese" battle group.
That's my cue.
Min'na-san, yoku mite kudasai. We know you're watching... so come and get a good look at us, Funayūrei!
We've got Morganas on the horizon. Let's give them more than just a good look.
@BATTLE
After the last engagement, we intercepted scattered Morgana reports. We believe they are trying to rally reinforcements to tackle an unexpected Japanese battle group.
I am glad we were able to help the merchants for a Weile, but those Nixenschicksen will eventually come back with greater numbers.
We need a way to get rid of them for a longer amount of time.

Fields.MenuText: The Morganas won't ever back down. They're fearless.
The Morganas will chase anything. We could try to lure them away.
The Morganas need to think we have overwhelming numbers.

Fields.DialogueText: Die Nixen – the Morganas – are aggressive... But, they are selten foolhardy. We might be able to intimidate them with...
Ein cleverer Plan. With more time it might work, but I'm afraid my top speed of 17 Knoten is going to be a Problem. How about...
Das ist es! Let's show them more than a Japanische battle group.
Let's show them... eine multi-nationale Task Force.
Maybe it's about time for the Americans to join in! Captain Jones, reporting for duty!
I have an idea. We can paint our other seaplane.
To look American?
Why not think even bigger? If we hurry, we could paint it to look British.
A coordinated task force with a big mix of naval forces? Bloody good idea, that!
I'll get on the radio and start broadcasting battle group commands. Even though it's all tosh, those Morganas might fall for it.
Full of surprises, Atlantis. I mean "Captain Jones."
If I'm reading our radar screen correctly, we've got an opportunity! Let's assault this small group of Morganas to the west... and get their main group's attention.
@BATTLE
That should take some attention away from the civilian vessels for now. The Morganas were hitting the merchants here pretty hard.
Great work, Atlantis!
The Morganas don't know what they're dealing with, amid all the  Japanese, Russian, British, American and German ships.
We're locken them away from the major waterways. Quite a false flag operation.
With a LOT of false flags!
An accomplishment our crew should take great pride in achieving, Kapitän...
... That is, if this pack of Morganas does not sink us here.

Fields.MenuText: We definitely stirred up a hornet's nest.
Maybe our tricks worked a little too well.
Steady as she goes, Atlantis. I know we can hold them off.

Fields.DialogueText: We are more than Tricks and Irreführung, Kapitän. We have our guns, too.
I've never been accused of being too effektiv before. I'll have to take that as a Kompliment.
Jawohl, Kapitän. If you say we will, we will!
The Morgana pack chasing us does have us worried – but they are still confused. If we can keep them off balance, we should be able to win the day.
The crew and I trust you for a reason, Atlantis.
@BATTLE
No sign of pursuing Nixe, Kapitän. We have finished evading the Morganas.
That means your plan was a complete success! Great work, as always, Atlantis.
I've got the final damage reports, by the way. Want to look at them with me over a cup of coffee?
Nein, Kapitän. That will not be necessary.
Oh?
I don't need to review the Berichte. I can feel the damage from our Gefecht.
Of course. Are you feeling all right?
Danke sehr, but I will be fine. Nothing too serious. Our false funnel and our Extramasten, however, have been destroyed by gunfire.

Fields.MenuText: Do you feel naked without your disguise equipment?
You must be glad that the deceptive gear was destroyed.
It's a lot better than getting real parts blown off.

Fields.DialogueText: Ich fühle mich ein wenig... vulnerable without it.
Ganz bestimmt nicht, but I'll be fine without it for now.
Ja! Well said, Kapitän.
They served their purpose for the Gefecht.
Don't say goodbye to them forever. I've already ordered Officer Raleigh to requisition replacements when we return to port.
Ha! Natürlich, Kapitän. I look forward to fully restoring our capabilities.
I declined to read the damage reports, but... I wouldn't refuse Kaffee and a Moment with you.
You have something else on your mind.
Ja, I do. It's... interessant to know that you can read me like that.
You know it comes from my super powers. Oh, have you already forgotten about those?
Richtig, richtig. But, what if you did have super powers? Then you could just read my Gedanken and save me from how difficult this is to say...
We've worked together and fought together, Atlantis. I know you can say it.
You perceive things in me, through all of my Verschleierungen and disguises, that I have trouble seeing for myself.
It feels so good to be seen, truly seen. I can be my real self around you with all my Macken and not feel ashamed or conflicted.
Because I can read you so well, Atlantis, I know what you are thinking. Perhaps, it's best if left unspoken.
Do you really think so? Danke... *kiss*
Let me pour you that cup of coffee. We can relax here a little longer, just the two of us.
That Kaffee will taste better than any cup I've jemals had!
I think so, too.
Morganas approaching. One more push...
@BATTLE
